Class Board

java.lang.Object
Logic.Board
public class Board extends Object
Represents the chess board, storing pieces and their positions on the board with a HashMap.

  • Constructor Summary

    Instantiates the Board.

  • Constructor Details

    • Board

      public Board(boolean fill)
      Instantiates the Board.
      Parameters:
      fill - If true, the board should be filled with the default pieces in their respective positions.

  • Method Details

    • fillBoard

      public void fillBoard()
      Fill the board with the default pieces in their respective positions.

    • getBoard

      public HashMap<String,ChessPiece> getBoard()
      Gets the reference of the board.
      Returns:
      The reference of the current board.

    • getPiece

      public ChessPiece getPiece(String position)
      Get the piece in a board position.
      Parameters:
      position - String with the position.
      Returns:
      The piece in the given position, or null if there isn't a piece there.

    • getPiece

      public ChessPiece getPiece(int[] position)
      Get the piece in a board position.
      Parameters:
      position - Integer vector with the position.
      Returns:
      The piece in the given position, or null if there isn't a piece there.

    • movePiece

      public void movePiece(int[] from, int[] to, GamePanel gamePanel)
      Moves the piece in a given position to another given position.
      Parameters:
      from - Integer vector with the current position of the piece.
      to - Integer vector with the new position of the piece.
      gamePanel - Reference of the GamePanel.

    • getPosition

      public int[] getPosition(ChessPiece piece)
      Gets the position of a given piece.
      Parameters:
      piece - A ChessPiece.
      Returns:
      Integer vector with the position of the given piece, or null if the piece is not on the board or does not exist.

    • getPiecesByColor

      public ArrayList<ChessPiece> getPiecesByColor(String color)
      Gets all pieces of a given player color.
      Parameters:
      color - String representing the player color ("white" or "black").
      Returns:
      ArrayList of ChessPiece with all pieces of the given player color.

    • getMyKing

      public King getMyKing(String color)
      Gets the King of a given player color.
      Parameters:
      color - String representing the color of a player ("white" or "black").
      Returns:
      King of the specified player color.

    • cloneBoard

      public Board cloneBoard()
      Clones the current board, creating a copy of it.
      Returns:
      A clone (copy) of the current board.

    • checkMate

      public boolean checkMate(boolean isWhiteTurn)
      Verify if there is a checkmate.
      Parameters:
      isWhiteTurn - If true, it's white's turn; if false, it's black's turn.
      Returns:
      True if the King of the current player is in checkmate, false if it isn't.

    • checkPromotion

      public ChessPiece checkPromotion(ChessPiece piece, int[] to, GamePanel gamePanel)
      Verify if a ChessPiece can be promoted.
      Parameters:
      piece - A ChessPiece.
      to - The ChessPiece's new position.
      gamePanel - Reference of GamePanel.
      Returns:
      The new ChessPiece, or the given piece (if it can't be promoted).

    • boardToString

      public String boardToString()
      Converts the board state to a String.
      Returns:
      String representing the current board state.

    • stringToBoard

      public void stringToBoard(String boardString)
      Loads the board state written as a String.
      Parameters:
      boardString - String representing a board state.
